etymology.description: Pictogram: Originally depicts a hand with a wart -> Variant form of 尤: retaining connotations of deformity
etymology.interpretation: 尢 is identified as a variant of 尤 and represents the notion of a man with bent legs, closely associating with deformity or deviation in form. The character still conveys variations perceived as abnormalities, similar to the original meaning of a hand with a wart.

examples.chinese: 他行走时显露出尢样步态(他行走時顯露出尢樣步態)，引得众人侧目(引得眾人側目)。
examples.pinyin: tā xíngzǒu shí xiǎnlù chū wān yàng bùtài, yǐn dé zhòngrén cèmù.
examples.english: When he walked, his bent-legged gait was evident, attracting sidelong glances from the crowd.

examples.chinese: 古籍记载尢人的形态(古籍記載尢人的形態)。
examples.pinyin: gǔjí jìzǎi wān rén de xíngtài.
examples.english: Ancient texts record the appearance of a man with bent legs.
